cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, crossing the Florida Big Bend Monday evening, then racing along/just offshore the Southeast U.S. coast and out over the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachicola–Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect at this time (earlier watch north of Altamaha Sound was upgraded to a warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to South Santee River, SC – includes Cape Canaveral area
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of the Florida Big Bend through the entire Atlantic coastline of Florida and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Low chance (most guidance 2-4 inches, isolated 5 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty east–northeast winds 35–45 mph possible Monday night into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation 1–2 ft above ground possible at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain totaling 2–4 inches, locally higher, late Monday through Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes embedded in outer rain-bands
